main_definition: The act of changing from one option, state, or action to another.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Changing channels on a television or radio receiver.
meanings_and_examples.example: I'm bored with this show, so I'll switch the channel to something more interesting.
He is good at multitasking and can easily switch from writing emails to designing graphics.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Transferring electrical power from one circuit to another in a system.
meanings_and_examples.example: The technician replaced the faulty fuse, restoring power by switching it back on.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Changing partners or collaborators in business or relationships.
meanings_and_examples.example: After the merger, many employees had to switch departments and work with new colleagues.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Switching focus or attention between different ideas or problems.
meanings_and_examples.example: She was able to switch her thoughts from math homework to her upcoming science project quickly.
